alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:19PM MDT until June 16 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Washington, Logan and Morgan Counties. ...The Flood Advisory is replaced with a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River near Balzac. * WHEN...From this evening to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Agricultural land floods along the river near Sterling. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise overnight approaching flood stage. It will remain near flood stage through Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
